description.value:
Poppets are small, basic constructs that typically help their owners with simple tasks. Occasionally, poppets gain sapience, independence, and a spark of life. Elevated beyond mere helpers or playthings, these poppets are free to chart their own destinies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.Ck8L9livQph1GFal]{Poppet}

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: The Grand Bazaar

description.value: The materials of your body resist ailments that assail the flesh. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against death effects, disease, and poison as well as to saving throws against effects that would give you the drained, paralyzed, or sickened conditions. Your spark of life means that you're a living creature, and you can be healed by vitality energy and harmed by void energy as normal.

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: The Grand Bazaar

rules.label: Constructed (vs. disease, poisons, death effects, paralysis, drained, and sickened)

description.value: You have weakness to fire damage equal to one-third your level (minimum 1).

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: The Grand Bazaar

description.value: You have little inside you other than cotton, sawdust, or dried leaves. You take no damage from falling, regardless of the distance you fall.

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: The Grand Bazaar

description.value:
You dedicated yourself to intense training and rigorous study to become a great warrior. The school you attended might have been a traditionalist monastery, an elite military academy, or the local branch of a prestigious mercenary organization.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Strength or Dexterity, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in your choice of the Acrobatics or Athletics skill. You gain a skill feat: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Cat Fall] if you chose Acrobatics or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Quick Jump] if you chose Athletics. You're also trained in the Warfare Lore skill.

You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.High Jump] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Long Jump] as a single action instead of 2 actions. If you do, you don't perform the initial Stride (nor do you fail if you don't Stride 10 feet).

Rage consumes you in battle. You delight in wreaking havoc and using powerful weapons to carve through your enemies, relying on astonishing durability without needing complicated techniques or rigid training. Your rages draw upon a vicious instinct, which you might associate with an animal, a spirit, or some part of yourself. To many barbarians, brute force is a hammer and every problem looks like a nail, whereas others try to hold back the storm of emotions inside them and release their rage only when it matters most.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.kzxu2dI7tFxv6Ix6.JournalEntryPage.lvuutBI9BSCU6cWe]{Barbarian}

Your rage wells up from a dominant instinct—one you learned from a tradition or that comes naturally to you. Your instinct gives you an ability, requires you to avoid certain behaviors, grants you increased damage and resistances at higher levels, and allows you to select feats tied to your instinct.
You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Rage] action, which lets you fly into a frenzy.
You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Quick-Tempered] free action, which lets you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Rage] at the slightest provocation.

Your rage comes from a deep and purely personal well within you. You use your rage as you choose.

Instinct Ability—Unstoppable Frenzy Increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 3. You gain a bonus 1st-level barbarian feat.

Specialization Ability (7th) Increase the additional damage from Rage from 3 to 7. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the additional damage from Rage to 13.

Raging Resistance (9th) You resist physical weapon damage, but not physical damage from other sources (such as unarmed attacks).

Your fury fills your foes with fear. While you are raging, your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Demoralize] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Scare to Death] actions (from the Intimidation skill and an Intimidation skill feat, respectively) gain the rage trait, allowing you to use them while raging. As soon as you meet the prerequisites for the skill feats Intimidating Glare and Scare to Death, you gain these feats.

Requirements You aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Fatigued] or raging.

You tap into your inner fury and begin raging. You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Constitution modifier. While you are raging:

  • You deal 2 additional damage on melee Strikes. This additional damage is halved if your weapon or unarmed attack is agile.

  • You can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Seek] while raging.

Rage lasts for 1 minute, until you fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Unconscious], or until the encounter ends, whichever comes first. You can't voluntarily stop raging. When you stop raging, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from Rage, and can't gain temporary Hit Points from using the Rage action again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.Effect: Rage Temporary Hit Points Immunity]

Trigger You roll initiative.

Requirements You are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Encumbered] or wearing heavy armor.

So long as you are able to move freely, your fury is instinctive and instantaneous. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Rage].

Toxins seep out of your artificial body quickly. Each time you succeed at a Fortitude save against an ongoing poison, you reduce its stage by 2, or by 1 against a virulent poison. Each critical success you achieve against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 against a virulent poison.

publication.title: Pathfinder Lost Omens: The Grand Bazaar

description.value: Desperate to finish the fight, you pour all your rage into one final blow. Make a Strike. If it hits, you gain a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of rounds remaining in your Rage (maximum 10). After this Strike, your Rage immediately ends, and you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Fatigued] until you rest for at least 10 minutes.

With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing. Stride twice. If you end your movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, you can make a melee @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Strike] against that enemy. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Sudden Charge] while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

Your techniques allow you to fight as you climb. You're not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Off-Guard] while Climbing and can Climb with a hand occupied. You must still use another hand and both legs to Climb.

You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Demoralize] with a mere glare. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.
This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra slashing power.

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Half Plate] armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

Activate 1 (concentrate)

This pendant is forged from grainy steel and depicts a snorting bull's face. The pendant must be attached to the chest area or on a shoulder guard. When you activate the pendant, attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Shove] with a +1 item bonus to check. Increase the distance you Shove your target to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Effect: Bronze Bull Pendant]
This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

Activate A (manipulate)

When you apply this thick, viscous oil to a weapon or suit of armor, that item immediately becomes magically potent. If the item is a weapon, it temporarily becomes a +1 striking weapon, or, if it's armor, it temporarily becomes +1 resilient armor. This lasts for 1 minute.
